title: Experience a Yoga Retreat with Ata Baechler of Insen Geneva at Ashford CastleTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Experience a Yoga Retreat with Ata Baechler of Insen Geneva at Ashford Castle Published on : Thursday, August 27, 2015
Nestled away from the hustle and bustle, the recently gloriously restored Ashford Castle, situated on the shores of Lough Corrib in the West of Ireland, is launching a dedicated yoga retreat hosted by famed Insens yoga instructor, Ata Baechler.
Taking place from Thursday , 19 th – Sunday, 22 nd November, guests will enjoy a carefully crafted yoga offering set to the tranquil backdrop of Ireland’s second largest lake.
The focus of the retreat is to escape a fast paced environment and take the time to slow down, to find calm and serenity through different forms of yoga and meditation while being pampered and nurtured in the luxury of one of Ireland’s most magnificent castle properties.
Ata Baechler has been living the life of a yogi for many years. He trained with Yoga Master Sri Dharma Mittra at the Kailashananda Temple in New York and subsequently perfected his practice in California, and Kerala, India, where he spent extended periods of time living a monastic life in ashrams. He is also an expert in the ancient art of Thai massage and has developed his own blend of treatments, mixing traditional Thai massage techniques with western osteopathic principals.
The programme includes the following Yoga sessions:
Asana and pranayama: to detox, de-stress, and boost energy for good health and vitality Hatha yoga: to recharge, relax, and be ready for the day Chanting and Yoga Nidra: to relieve the daily tensions, anxiety and other emotional problems Gentle yoga: a slow paced stretching class to learn basic poses and relaxation techniques Pranayama and meditation: to increase energy, relieve stress and tension
Available as a three night package, the retreat may be combined with a golf package or other packages for partners.

Total Package Price
Single Room ~ €1,195.00 per room
Double Room ~ €1,725.00 per room
Spousal supplement on the single room €350.00 on dinner, bed and breakfast, one hour falconry lesson and an Ayurvedic head massage.
The Ashford estate offers a wide range of activities including fishing, cruising on the Lough Corrib, nature walking, kayaking, archery, clay pigeon shooting, golf, tennis, cycling, horse riding and Ireland’s first school of falconry. These, coupled with the new Spa offering treatments using Elemis and Brand Voya products, provide the perfect combination of exercise and relaxation.
Niall Rochford, General Manager of Ashford Castle said: “The fast pace of modern living can leave us disregarding our own health and wellbeing, so we’re excited to be welcoming Ata Baechler to Ashford Castle and offering guests the opportunity to slow down in peaceful surroundings and ultimate luxury.”
